discussion.content: Answer is AD. Multi AD for HA, and Multi Region for DR.

questions.question_text:
Your company has decided to move a few applications to Oracle Cloud and you have been asked to design it for both High Availability (HA) and Disaster
Recovery (DR).
Which two should you consider while designing your Oracle Cloud Infrastructure architecture? (Choose two.)

choices.C: Start and open the database instance
choices.B: Open port 1521 in the VCN to allow for traffic to the listener
choices.D: Switchover and failover in an Oracle Guard configuration

discussion.content: ACD is correct

Using the dbaascli utility, you can:

Change the password of a database user.

Start and stop a database.

Start and stop the Oracle Net listener

Check the status of the Oracle Data Guard configuration.

Perform switchover and failover in an Oracle Data Guard configuration.

Patch the database deployment.

Perform database recovery.

Rotate the master encryption key.
ACD is correct

below are true

Change the password of a database user.

Start and stop a database.

Start and stop the Oracle Net listener

Check the status of the Oracle Data Guard configuration.

Perform switchover and failover in an Oracle Data Guard configuration.

Patch the database deployment.

Perform database recovery.

Rotate the master encryption key.

So ACD are correct

database

bounce – shuts down and then restarts the database instance.

changepassword – changes the password of the specified user.

start– starts the database instance and opens the database.

status – displays the open mode of the database and additional information about the database deployment.

stop – shuts down the database instance.

Using the dbaascli utility, you can:

Change the password of a database user.

Start and stop a database.

Start and stop the Oracle Net listener

Check the status of the Oracle Data Guard configuration.

Perform switchover and failover in an Oracle Data Guard configuration.

Patch the database deployment.

Perform database recovery.

Rotate the master encryption key.
